Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Portfolio \Port*fol"io\, n. [F. portefeuille; porter to carry + feuille a leaf. See {Port} to carry, and {Folio}.] 1. A portable case for holding loose papers, prints, drawings, etc. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence: The office and functions of a minister of state or member of the cabinet; as, to receive the portfolio of war; to resign the portfolio. [1913 Webster]

portfolio n 1: a case for carrying papers or drawings or maps; usually leather 2: a list of the financial assets held by an individual or a bank or other financial institution 3: the role of the head of a government department; "he holds the portfolio for foreign affairs"
